se.cbb.jprime.seqevo

Enum SequenceType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<SequenceType>
      • se.cbb.jprime.seqevo.SequenceType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SequenceType>

    public enum SequenceType
extends java.lang.Enum<SequenceType>
    The various sequence types. These are used for substitution models, and stems from C++ PrIME, although BioJava has similar stuff. In general, each state has both a character representation and an integer representation (the latter being the character's index in the alphabet).
    Author:
    Bengt Sennblad., Lars Arvestad., Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • DNA

        public static final SequenceType DNA
        Used for DNA sequences. The alphabet has 4 states: a=0, c=1, g=2, t=3. The alternative alphabet has 13 states and represents different combination of the 4 basic nucleotides. E.g. m is a or c with 50% on each. m(ac)=01, r(ag)=02, w(at)=03, s(cg)=12, y(ct)=13, k(gt)=23, v(acg)=012, h(act)=013, d(agt)=023, b(cgt)=123, x(acgt)=n(acgt)=-(acgt)=0123. See http://www.hgu.mrc.ac.uk/Softdata/Misc/ambcode.htm for more info.

      • AMINO_ACID

        public static final SequenceType AMINO_ACID
        Used for AA sequences. The alphabet has 20 states that represents the different amino acids: a=1, r=2, n=3, d=4, c=5, q=6, e=7, g=8, h=9, i=10, l=11, k=12, m=13, f=14, p=15, s=16, t=17, w=18, y=19, v=20. The alternative alphabet has 4 states and represents different combination of the 20 basic AAs, b=21, z=22, x=23, -=24 b=dn z=eq x=acdefghiklmnpqrstvwy. See http://www.hgu.mrc.ac.uk/Softdata/Misc/ambcode.htm for more info.

      • CODON

        public static final SequenceType CODON
        Used for codon sequences. The alphabet has 61 states, all three letter combination of the nucleotides except for the most common stop codons (4^3-3=61). Instead of using three letter symbols we invent a char representation.

        public static SequenceType[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (SequenceType c : SequenceType.values())
    System.out.println(c);

      • getSequenceType

        public static SequenceType getSequenceType(java.lang.String name)
        If you have a string description of a sequence type, the following method returns a statically allocated object of that type.

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Returns the type, e.g. "DNA" or "Amino acid".
        Returns:
        the type.

      • get

        public int get(char state)
        Returns the integer equivalent of a character.
        Parameters:
        state - the character.
        Returns:
        the corresponding integer.

      • getAlphabetSize

        public int getAlphabetSize()
        The number of states in the alphabet. E.g., for DNA this is 4.
        Returns:
        the length.

      • char2int

        public int char2int(char c)
        Returns the integer value for a specific state in the sequence alphabet. Alternative (ambiguity) alphabet uses values > alphabet size, i.e., as if appended to the original alphabet.
        Parameters:
        c - a state from the alphabet.
        Returns:
        the integer code.

      • int2char

        public char int2char(int i)
        Returns the specific state in the sequence alphabet from its integer index. Alternative (ambiguity) alphabet use values > alphabet size, i.e., as if appended after the original alphabet.
        Parameters:
        i - the integer code.
        Returns:
        a state (character) from the alphabet.

      • stringTranslate

        public int[] stringTranslate(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a string with states in text format to a vector of state values.
        Parameters:
        s - char values.
        Returns:
        int states.

      • getLeafLikelihood

        public org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F getLeafLikelihood(char state)
        Returns a vector of likelihoods for a leaf with a character. The size of the vector equals the alphabet size and the likelihood is the probability that the leaf is in a specific state.
        Parameters:
        state - character.
        Returns:
        likelihood.

      • getLeafLikelihood

        public org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F getLeafLikelihood(int i)
        Returns a vector of likelihoods for a leaf with a character. The size of the vector equals the alphabet size and the likelihood is the probability that the leaf is in a specific state.
        Parameters:
        i - character index. May be an ambiguity state as well.
        Returns:
        likelihood.

      • getTypeLikelihood

        public double getTypeLikelihood(java.lang.String s)
        Returns (roughly) how likely it is that the given sequence came from the present alphabet? The alternative alphabet is also considered.
        Parameters:
        s - the sequence.
        Returns:
        a measure of how likely the string is of the current type.

      • codonStr2int

        public int codonStr2int(java.lang.String codon_str)
        Returns the integer value of a codon triplet. Codon needs to override default conversion due to the 3 letter coding.
        Parameters:
        codon_str - triplet, case insensitive.
        Returns:
        int state.

      • codonInt2str

        public java.lang.String codonInt2str(int codon)
        Returns the codon triplet from an integer value. Codon needs to override default conversion due to the 3 letter coding.
        Parameters:
        codon - state.
        Returns:
        triplet in upper case.
